page.title: 10General Description
page.content: The 12 Km Sq block contains the village of Blackford (area approximately 1/2 Km Sq) and has a distillery and a spring water water bottling plant. The population is approximately 500. The block is crossed from east to west by a main railway line and the A9 dual carriageway road, each passing north and south of the village respectively. Arable farmland and grassland cover much of the southern half while rough grazing and woodland cover most of the northern half. The Allan water river flows across the block on its way to the river Forth. It is fed from various burns and streams running from the Ochil Hills in the South and the rising woodlands to the North. The north eastern corner contains part of Gleneagles golf course.
